result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Bill. Filed by Atty Skatrud. Approved by RMW on 01-18-17. hml
cc: Atty, DE, COC and Collections. hml
Pd. 01-24-2017 with ck#00700-2121 for $465.00. gme

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM624 & 16CM301:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud   DF:  Stoney Dwayne Orr appeared. Case called at 10:05 a.m. Court notes these matters are set for a plea and sentencing hearing. ADA McKinley recites agreement and recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 16CM301 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Misd. Bail Jumping   in 16CM301. On motion of the State without objecton, 15CM624 is dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal.

Crt orders:

In file 16CM301:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report to probation no later than 1 p.m. today. Bond will continue until reports to probation. 

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Debby Hagglund.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  

- $243.00 Court Costs. Bond to apply

- $200.00 DNA Sample and Surcharge

- $57.00 Fine
Final notice sent, due 10-13-16. cah
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Atty's request a plea date. Address confirmed. Bond continues. km  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 09:45 am.
per pmt. Faxed dispatch and Sheriff. New date given to DE. gme

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley . Stoney Dwayne Orr pro se. Case called at 9:23 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a pre trial conference. DE would like to petition for an attorney today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 03-11-2016 09:00 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: LiddleADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley. Stoney Dwayne Orr pro se. Case called at 1:33 p.m. ADA McKinley states she has been in contact with the victim in this matter. Ready to extend an offer. Court goes over the rights with the DE on his right to obtain an attorney. Court will find that DE is competent to represent himself and finds that he knowingly and intelligently waives his right to an attorney. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Paper file also. km
Pre-trial conference at 02-08-2016 01:30 pm

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: LiddleADA:  Edward Minser. Stoney Dwayne Orr pro se. Case called at 2:30 p.m. Mr. Orr would like to continue pro se. ADA Minser makes statement. Requesting another pre trial conference to see if a resolution can be made. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 12-23-2015 02:30 pm

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

 It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Debby H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO:  RMW, (Reporter) Val Deiss, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly,  Stoney Dwayne Orr pro se. Court confirms address. Court goes over rights for an attorney.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
